meanings.sent1: The hong of the thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: I heard a hong coming from the old bell tower.
meanings.sent3: The hong of the gong made everyone jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The hong of the church bells echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The hong of the drum signaled the start of the parade.

meanings.definition: A Chinese business organization or guild.
meanings.sent1: The hong was known for its successful trade routes.
meanings.sent2: She joined the hong to expand her business network.
meanings.sent3: The hong's logo featured a traditional dragon design.
meanings.sent4: The hong's influence extended far beyond the city.
meanings.sent5: Members of the hong gathered for their annual meeting.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, deep sound.
meanings.sent1: The drum honged loudly during the festival.
meanings.sent2: The old clock tower honged every hour.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally honged the gong too early.
meanings.sent4: The church bells honged to announce the wedding.
meanings.sent5: The thunder honged in the distance, signaling a storm.
